Comments_List: I learned a lot about modern sculpture and how it related to basic themes.

I was able to further develop my technical skills in metal work and learn the tools in the wood shop from scratch. I also enjoyed the discussions where I learned to discuss theoretical aspects of sculpture and art.
A partner project would have been  neat

The strengths were the opportunity to mix theory and practice. A weakness of the course was that the schedule was often changed and I felt that this could be adhered to more strongly. An improvement could be to have more slack built in to the calendar from the start, e.g. work days
Yes! A fun class, with high time requirements but the assignments aren't terribly difficult, just time consuming. Elizabeth is a fantastic teacher!
yes!! both wood and metal shops are entirely open to students  mostly self-directed assignments. you can make what you want and elizabeth will help make it happen.
